entries.title: China Slams US on Debt Limit and Accuses Washington of Sabotage
entries.description: China invoked the US’s brinkmanship over its own debt limit as it hit back at Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen’s criticism of Beijing’s handling of debt issues in developing countries.

entries.title: Brazil, Argentina Eye Common Unit for Trade, Not a Single Currency, Minister Says
entries.description: South American nations planning a common unit of account to promote trade rather than a single currency, Brazil’s finance minister says

entries.title: White House Weighing GOP Panel’s Request On Classified Documents
entries.description: The White House said Monday it would review requests a Republican-run House panel made for information related to President Joe Biden’s handling of classified documents, but suggested it will not give the committee all that it wants.

entries.title: Schumer Dares House GOP to Show Math for ‘Draconian’ Budget Cuts
entries.description: Chuck Schumer

entries.title: Trump and Biden Are Getting the Same DOJ Treatment on Documents Probes, Garland Says
entries.description: Attorney General Merrick Garland dismissed criticism that the Justice Department is treating Donald Trump and Joe Biden differently when it comes to investigating their handling of classified documents.

entries.title: Florida CFO Bans More State Pension Funds From Investing in ESG
entries.description: Florida Chief Financial Officer Jimmy Patronis blocked asset managers from investing a $5.1 billion state pension pool in sustainable funds, the latest escalation in his fight against ESG.

entries.title: Serbia May Lose Chance to Join EU If It Rejects Kosovo Plan, Vucic Says
entries.description: Aleksandar Vucic, Serbia's president, pauses during an interview at his office in Belgrade, Serbia, on Thursday, Oct. 25, 2018. Russia’s biggest ally in the Balkans says he won’t cross German Chancellor Angela Merkel, however hard that sometimes might be.

entries.title: US to Boost Pressure on China to Stop Importing Iran Oil, Envoy Says
entries.description: The Biden administration’s top Iran envoy said it will increase pressure on China to cease imports of Iranian oil as the US tries to enforce nuclear sanctions.

entries.title: State Street CEO Warns a US Downgrade Could See Treasuries Drop
entries.description: Ron O’Hanley Photographer: Dania Maxwell/Bloomberg

entries.title: ‘Don’t Waste Your Time,’ RNC Tells Potential Debate Hosts
entries.description: Ronna McDaniel

entries.title: UK to Probe Hiring of BBC Chair as Sunak’s Ethics Concerns Grow
entries.description: The UK will look into how BBC Chairman Richard Sharp was appointed to his role, following allegations that he was recommended for the job weeks after helping then-Prime Minister Boris Johnson secure an £800,000 loan guarantee. The probe is the second investigation launched into potential government impropriety in a single day.

entries.title: UK Urges EU Not to Harm British Firms in US Clean Power Fight
entries.description: The UK is urging the European Union not to harm British companies as European leaders debate whether to match measures in the US Inflation Reduction Act with massive green subsidies of their own.

entries.title: US Sanctions Iran Foundation Used to Fund Protest Crackdown
entries.description: The US Treasury Department imposed fresh sanctions on an Iranian foundation it said is used as a slush fund by the Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps in connection with efforts to quash anti-government protests.

entries.title: Erdogan to Forgive Debt of Turks in Pre-Election Voter Giveaway
entries.description: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan said his ruling AK Party will propose a bill to relieve the debt burden of millions of people, a move aimed at strengthening his voter base ahead of this year’s elections.

entries.title: Violent Demonstrations Roil Peru’s Southern Copper and Tourism Heartland
entries.description: The focus of Peru’s violent unrest shifted back to the impoverished rural south after mass demonstrations in Lima last week failed to unseat the fragile government of President Dina Boluarte.

entries.title: Sweden Shouldn’t Expect Turkey Support in NATO Bid, Erdogan Says
entries.description: Turkey won’t support Sweden’s bid to join the North Atlantic Treaty Organization, President Recep Tayyip Erdogan said on Monday, venting anger at burning of Islam’s holy book in the Swedish capital of Stockholm.

entries.title: Brazil Seeks to Finance Argentine Importers, Emulating China
entries.description: Brazil plans to finance Argentine importers interested in buying its products in a bid to recover market share lost to China, according to two people familiar with the plan.

entries.title: Ex-FBI Official Charged With Work for Russian Oligarch Deripaska
entries.description: A retired FBI official was charged with working for the Russian Oligarch Oleg Deripaska in violation of US sanctions.

entries.title: Baltic Relations With Moscow Deteriorate in Diplomatic Standoff
entries.description: Relations between Russia and the Baltic region reached a new low as tit-for-tat expulsions and staff cuts were set to leave no ambassador-level diplomats between the nations.

entries.title: White House Uses GOP Oil Bills to Go on Gasoline-Price Offensive
entries.description: The White House is turning the tables on Republicans, using messaging bills related to the nation’s emergency oil stockpiles to accuse the newly GOP-controlled chamber of raising gasoline prices for Americans.

entries.title: Kuwait Cabinet Quits, Outwitting Lawmakers Bent on Oil Wealth Splurge
entries.description: Kuwait’s government has resigned, barely six months after being appointed, as it tries to out-maneuver lawmakers seeking to pass legislation ministers say would strain state finances.

entries.title: Supreme Court Seeks US Views on Texas, Florida Social Media Laws
entries.description: The US Supreme Court asked the Biden administration for input on Florida and Texas laws that would sharply restrict the editorial discretion of the largest social media platforms in a First Amendment showdown.

entries.title: Ex-Deutsche Bank Traders Rejected by Supreme Court in ‘Spoof’ Case
entries.description: The US Supreme Court refused to review the convictions of two former Deutsche Bank AG precious-metals traders for manipulating gold and silver prices with “spoof” trade orders.

entries.title: Israeli Economy in Danger, Central Bank Panelist Says After Resignation
entries.description: A voting member of the Bank of Israel’s monetary committee stepped down and warned that “democracy is in danger” in his country, marking one of the highest-profile departures since Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu began his push to reform the judicial system.

entries.title: Yellen Criticizes China, Urges Headway in Zambian Debt Talks
entries.description: US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen urged Zambia’s creditors to work quickly to restructure the southern Africa nation’s debts, and accused China of obstructing a deal.

entries.title: Sinema Faces Potential 2024 Clash as Arizona Democrat Jumps In
entries.description: Arizona US Representative Ruben Gallego launched his widely expected bid for the Senate seat currently held Kyrsten Sinema, who left the party last month to become an independent.

entries.title: FDA Lays Out Annual Covid Shot Plan Similar to Flu
entries.description: US drug regulators are setting out a plan for updating Covid-19 vaccines similar to the one in place for flu that will include at least annual reviews of new strains to be targeted by shots.

entries.title: Boeing's DC Powerbroker Rebuilds Clout After Fallout From 737 Max Crash
entries.description: Boeing Co.’s rainmaker in Washington, a former auto lobbyist who goes by the nickname “Z,” is restoring some of the swagger that once made the aerospace giant a force on Capitol Hill.

entries.title: Pharma CEOs Are Among Likely Targets for Senate Democrats’ Subpoenas
entries.description: Senate Democrats plan their own political counter-programming to House Republicans’ threats of wide-ranging probes into Joe Biden’s administration and his family, taking on issues like corporate tax avoidance and union-busting, issues sure to rankle the GOP.

entries.title: South Africa Inquires About Rapid Deployment of Power Ships
entries.description: South Africa made fresh inquiries about securing electricity supply from Turkey’s Karpowership as it battles its worst ever power outages, according to people familiar with the situation.

entries.title: Macron Plows Ahead With Pension Reform as More Protests Loom
entries.description: French President Emmanuel Macron’s government formally presented its flagship pension reform at a cabinet meeting on Monday, paving the way for parliament to debate it as unions and opposition parties ready further strikes and protests against the plan.

entries.title: Czech Tycoon, Trailing in Race, Draws Ire Over NATO Comments
entries.description: Former Czech Prime Minister Andrej Babis, who is trailing in his bid to win the nation’s presidency this week, drew criticism for saying during a televised debate that he wouldn’t send troops to aid NATO allies.

entries.title: Russia's Weekly Oil Exports Slump Back Down After Surge
entries.description: Shipments in the week to Jan. 20 lost almost all the gain seen the previous seven days

entries.title: EU Backs More Iran Sanctions Over Crackdown on Protestors
entries.description: European Union foreign ministers backed more sanctions on more individuals and entities over Iran’s crackdown on some of the country’s biggest protests in decades, sparked by the death in police custody of a young woman.

entries.title: A Polarized US Hurtles Toward a Fiscal Cliff
entries.description: The risk has never been higher that the world’s largest economy could default on its national debt for the first time.

entries.title: Even Democrats Are Now Critical of Biden Over Documents Fiasco
entries.description: US President Joe Biden had hoped to put the mishandling of sensitive government files behind him. Instead, the emergence of another batch of classified material now has his own party upset at him.

entries.title: Burkina Faso Cuts French Military Ties in Jihadist Fight
entries.description: Burkina Faso ended its military collaboration with France, the second West African nation to sever defense links that were forged to combat a decade-long Islamist insurgency in the region.

entries.title: Latvia Slams Berlin Over Leopard Tanks Indecision for Ukraine
entries.description: Latvia’s top envoy criticized Germany over its indecision on whether to send Ukraine the Leopard 2 tanks, saying there are no longer any “good arguments” not to give Kyiv the heavier weapons it demands.

entries.title: Ukraine Latest: EU Foreign Ministers to Discuss Tanks Deliveries
entries.description: Foreign ministers of the European Union meet in Brussels, with the issue of tank deliveries to Ukraine among the topics on their agenda. Lithuanian Foreign Minister Gabrielius Landsbergis and his other Baltic counterparts called on Germany over the weekend to provide the tanks.

entries.title: South Africa Defends Naval Exercise With Russia and China
entries.description: South Africa defended its planned naval exercise with Russia and China next month amid criticism over its noncommital stance on the war in Ukraine.

entries.title: Japan Premier Kishida Seeks Labor Market Shakeup to Raise Pay
entries.description: Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida said he’d press ahead with labor market reforms to create an environment for sustainable pay rises in a policy-setting address to a new parliament session, which is clouded by inflation hitting its highest level since 1981.

entries.title: Britishvolt Is a Monument to Global Britain’s Empty Hype
entries.description: The reality of Brexit dashes UK hopes to be a major EV player

entries.title: Desperate to Be a CEO? Here’s the Worst Job in Global Energy
entries.description: South African utility Eskom needs a new boss. But it’s drowning in debt and hasn’t managed to keep the lights on since 2017.

entries.title: Pakistan Faces Major Nationwide Power Breakdown, Ministry Says
entries.description: Pakistan faced a major nationwide power breakdown on Monday because of “reduced frequency” in the national grid, the energy ministry said in a Twitter message.

entries.title: Congo Opposition Leader Says He’d Scrap Oil Drilling in No. 2 Rainforest
entries.description: Congolese opposition leader Moise Katumbi said he would cancel a controversial plan to allow drilling for oil and gas in one of the world’s most important carbon sinks if he wins an election later this year.

entries.title: How India's Bid to Reform Bankruptcy Law Affects Payouts to Creditors
entries.description: India’s bid to streamline bankruptcy proceedings includes provisions that could change the proportion of money creditors get from a firm’s liquidation.

entries.title: Australia’s Health System Prime Target for Hacks, Minister Says
entries.description: Australia’s hospitals and health care system are at a high risk from cyberattackers targeting citizens’ personal data, the home affairs minister said, adding the country needed to step up its efforts to combat hacking attempts.

entries.title: Hipkins Confirmed as New Zealand’s Next Prime Minister
entries.description: There is a new prime minister in New Zealand. His name is Chris Hipkins and he signaled a policy overhaul and is vowing to prioritize the economy. Ben Westcott reports on Bloomberg Television. (Source: Bloomberg)

entries.title: Biden 2020 Campaign Chief to Stay at White House Amid Aide Swaps
entries.description: Joe Biden’s deputy chief of staff, Jen O’Malley Dillon, has ruled out returning as campaign manager for the president’s planned 2024 reelection bid, people familiar with the matter say.

entries.title: Australia Speeds Up Purchase of Sea Mines With Eye on China
entries.description: The Australian government is looking to speed up the purchase of a new generation of sea mines to protect its ports amid growing concern over China’s military build-up and expanding influence in the Pacific.

entries.title: CBI Tells Tories to End Tax War and Prioritize UK’s Green Growth
entries.description: The UK’s ruling Conservative party should stop fighting itself over tax and prioritize green growth, the head of a prominent business group will say Monday.

entries.title: UK Ambulance Staff Stage Biggest Strike Yet as Unions Join Forces
entries.description: Ambulance workers are walking out on Monday in their biggest show of industrial action by first responders since trade unions kicked off an historic series of protests against pay levels in Britain’s National Health Service.
